revision.text:
{{Infobox_President | name=William Jefferson Clinton | image=Bill_Clinton.jpg | size=240px | order=42nd [[President of the United States]] | term_start=[[January 20]] [[1993]] | term_end=[[January 20]] [[2001]] | vicepresident=[[Al Gore]] | predecessor=[[George H. W. Bush]] | successor=[[George W. Bush]] | death_date= | birth_date=[[August 19]] [[1946]] | birth_place=[[Hope, Arkansas|Hope]], [[Arkansas]] | party=[[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrat]] | spouse=[[Hillary Rodham Clinton]] }} '''William Jefferson Clinton''' (born [[August 19]], [[1946]]), better known as '''Bill Clinton''', was the 42nd [[president]] of the [[United States]]. He served from [[1993]] to [[2001]]. He was 46 years old when he was elected. His major opponents were [[George H. W. Bush]] and [[Bob Dole]]. Clinton was the first president from the [[Baby Boom]] generation and was the third youngest president in the U.S. He is a [[United States Democratic Party|Democrat]]. Clinton's supporters say he helped bring the [[economy|economic]] boom of the 1990s. His presidency was very [[wikt:controversy|controversial]] to most [[Republican]]s, who did not agree with what he did.
Before he was president, Clinton was also [[governor]] of [[Arkansas]] ([[1979]]-[[1981]] and [[1983]]-[[1993]]).
In [[1994]], during Clinton's first term in office, the [[United States Congress|Congress]] switched to a [[United States Republican Party|Republican]] majority. However, Clinton still beat Republican [[Bob Dole]] in the [[1996]] election.
President Clinton was accused of wrongdoing by the [[United States House of Representatives|U.S. House of Representatives]] in [[December]] [[1998]] during the [[Lewinsky scandal|Monica Lewinsky scandal]]. Although he lied that she did not give him oral sex, he was found to have done nothing wrong by the [[United States Senate|U.S. Senate]] in [[February]] [[1999]]. The scandal had little effect on his popularity, and he left office with some of the highest approval ratings of any president.
[[Image:Pele-Clinton 1997.jpg|thumb|left|President Clinton and [[Pele]] playing [[soccer]]]]
He is married to Senator [[Hillary Rodham Clinton|Hillary Clinton]] and now lives in [[New York]].
==Other websites== *[http://www.bill-clinton-peace.blogspot.com/ Photos of Bill Clinton's actions to bring peace to the Middle East.] *[http://www.whitehouse.gov/history/presidents/bc42.html Bill Clinton's White House biography]
